reviews.title: First Class Design Hotel Experience
reviews.text: Two things made our stay at the Wiesergut one of our top two design hotel experiences:

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: First the architecture and interior design: wherever you look you will find a beautiful and harmonious sight. Be it the large colourful garden, the sleek yet warm interior (think wood, stone and steel, custom made furniture reminiscent of danish design, large rooms and bathrooms, natural high quality materials, earthy tones, lots of space and light ...), the peaceful spa with delicious scents of swiss pine, the mountain panorama, the sound of the water well, the bonfire at night ... everything lets you wind down, relax and enjoy every minute of your experience.
reviews.title: A New 2013 Excellent Retreat Resort ~ Now Is The Time...
Nicht gut! Pretentious, unhelpful reception and overpriced hotel.
reviews.text: Secondly the friendliness of staff and natural warmth of the owners. Any time we wanted anything it was at our front door or on our plates immediately. As the staff got to know us after a few days they brought our favourite items without us even asking. The owner, Sepp Kröll is present every day and always looking after you in natural and welcoming way. In the early evening you will often be greeted by Sepp's wife Martina with a sweet "hallo" as she takes care of the garden. Sometimes her cute young children also help, which adds to the comfort of staying at a family run boutique hotel. The Kröll family and the staff infuse this place with life and warmth and round off the experience to be perfect.
Some more goodies you will find at Wiesergut:
reviews.title: 9 out of ten !!
